lines.text: President Cleveland's proclamation will be issued any day now and the claims will be filed through the Red Dust land office just like I figured.
That's what Parker's been telling me.
Who's Parker?
The land agent here.
Can we get to him?
I already got to him. He likes to play roulette. He owes me $6500.
So he's been buckin' that crooked wheel of yours, huh?

[hurt]
Oh, Ben. Let's say out of balance... It sounds much nicer.
Why that's wholesale claim jumping!
Let's dispense with that term, Parker. I prefer to call it land promotion.
I tell you, Parker, I filed my claim according to regulation. This Matt Johnson's a claim jumper!
You say you filed a claim, but I have no record of it in my book, Mr. Green. There it is in black and white. The lot you say is yours is recorded by Mr. Matt Johnson.
Then this record book don't tell the truth.
Are you accusing me of being crooked?
Ah, let me handle this matter, my friend - I am a lawyer. Yes sir, I will get out a writ of habeus corpuscles. I will nully contender that man Johnson.
Maybe we're not as half as bad off as we think we are.
We couldn't be any worse off. Why the menfolks haven't even got a vote.
If we can prove our cases against those claim jumpers, then they will be the illegal residents.
In the meantime, Flint will be running the new county as Sheriff.
If there were only some way these folks could establish legal residence.
Oh, yes, but there isn't. I just wrecked, or at least I wracked my brains to think of something. I even read one of my own lawbooks.
You seem to know a lot about your land laws.
A wandering cowboy picks up a lot of information... most of it's worthless.
I tell you, I will take this case to the Supreme Court. Even higher!
